instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
This device had liquid damage. It did not turn on.
I have changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. One pin of the chip was "burned". After that the device did turn on. but only in smc bypass mode.
if i try it to boot normally it show me battery low symbol. I have already tried a new battery. 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery only connected is only 3V.
Both I2C lines (SDA/SDC) from battery connector show almost same dioode mode reaeding (approx 0.3V)
what could be the issue here? the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips ??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
Cannot be USB-C issue, if machine starts in SMC bypass.
Post exact resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23; between their pins I mean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
Which pin of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was burnt?
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (without battery).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message: i dont know anymore :/ i belive pin 3. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery is 12.61V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is correct then.
If you connect battery, it will drop, according with battery level.
The voltage will increase and go back to 12.6V, once battery is fully charged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message: But it does not charge it. nor will it run on an already charged battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stays at 12.6V even with battery connected?

Do you have now good contact for all <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> balls?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message: Inspect areas immediately near USB-C connectors on board. VERY common for people to knock off the diodes/caps when disconnecting the USB-C assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message: [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] Should i measure ACOK and A/BMON with battery connected ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
A/BMON better to measure with battery connected.
Then will reflect battery charging current, if charges...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
[USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> 300mV when it turns on (fan spins) and 0mV when its off. <SIGNAL>CHRG_BMON</SIGNAL> is always 0mV.
Wich voltage should i expect on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>???. i do have I2C communiaction on SDA and SCL lines

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
Try another battery.
Better old one, known good working, just for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
macOS recognizes battery?
Look in System Report too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message: now it crashes if itry to boot in smc-bypass mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message:
All USB-C ports switch to 20V?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> correct and stable?
Did you try SMC bypass without battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low on battery
threads.message: I just remembered something I saw recently, and just to be safe: Make sure you have the battery communication cable right-side-up. Had a customer with similar issues and it turned out he had his battery cable installed upside down...
